block.p: Mary Frances Roethel, a daughter of Gail and Harold Roethel of Fayetteville, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Michael Edwin Turnbull, a son of Dr. Desna Turnbull of Buffalo and Lyndley Turnbull of Lewisdale, Md. The Rev. Gregory C. LeStrange performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception.

Mrs. Turnbull, 37, is a vice president and business manager of a research department at Salomon Smith Barney in New York. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College and received an M.B.A. from Fordham University. Her father is an account manager in Fayetteville for Oce Printing Systems USA. Her mother retired as the accounting manager at the Smith Group, an advertising agency that was in Syracuse.

Mary Frances Roethel, a daughter of Gail and Harold Roethel of Fayetteville, N.Y., was married there yesterday to Michael Edwin Turnbull, a son of Dr. Desna Turnbull of Buffalo and Lyndley Turnbull of Lewisdale, Md. The Rev. Gregory C. LeStrange performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Conception.

Mrs. Turnbull, 37, is a vice president and business manager of a research department at Salomon Smith Barney in New York. She graduated from Mount Holyoke College and received an M.B.A. from Fordham University. Her father is an account manager in Fayetteville for Oce Printing Systems USA. Her mother retired as the accounting manager at the Smith Group, an advertising agency that was in Syracuse.

Mr. Turnbull, also 37, is a vice president and e-business investment product manager at Citibank in New York. He graduated from Williams College and received an M.B.A. from Indiana University. His mother is an assistant professor of hospitality management at Buffalo State College of the State University of New York. His father owns the Lynn-Phil Construction Company in Washington. The bridegroom is a stepson of Mary Turnbull.
